find: thanks
i can't find /tmp partition
i don't know
where i can i find it ?
when i do fdisk -l i just only all disk
thx let me check
i don't have information about /tmp with df -h
ok what should contain the /tmp folder ?
normally
/tmp is full of temporary files
sockets used for IPC, for the most part
but it's also a place for dumping temporary text and data
basically anything which is not permanent, that needs to be accessible to programs
define what you mean by using it for backup
all the files on it get purged on reboot, so if you meant using it for storage it's the antithesis of a good idea
there's lots of data in /tmp when you startup, because lots of programs use it
for instance, pulseaudio, that starts at boot
but even if it wasn't purged, storing those files there is inappropriate
or at least, as inappropriate as storing them any old place on the filesystem
http://ubuntu-tutorials.com/2008/01/19/changing-the-tmp-cleanup-frequency/ configures the frequency that tmp is dumped
